column5: And it was.LOL  Not really. Any time your out fishing is great.  Seem we are still a couple weeks away from the bite happening. Every morning up here is in the minus, sun dosent get to it,s peak temps til after lunch or later. By that time, the temps start to drop. No real chance for the northern lakes to warm up.  Oh well. Better then sitting at home right.  These never get boring. BEAUTIFUL    Sat my toon in 12 fow and marked. Thought they were crappy, but turned out to be perch and blue gills. Not what we were looking for.       After it slowed, we moved around. Terry moved more then I. I think he covered the whole lake. He,s out there somewhere.LOL Dead center in the pic.    Stuck it out til noonish, then called it.      Calling for high winds and rain Sunday. Looks like a damper on our pickeral opener.  Maybe hit a couple of res trout  spots early in the am.
It was good to get outAll I caught was some crappie about this size , good thing I didn't get something big. My net went for a swim and escaped to live with the fishes.
Thats a bigg,n compared to the one I got.   What is it?  A crappie.  It is ?  Me thinks so. Never seen one this tiny.    LMAO
When you're still toonin' in yer baffins, that's when ya know it's time to either wait a week or fish for lakers lol  Looks like fun.
A couple more weeks? By then pike and walleye will be open. Hockey finishes tomorrow morning at 8am and then I'll start stringing up rods.
Your next net you get take the end cap off and spray some expansion foam in the handle no more lost nets.If it is a expandable handle fill the inside pole with foam.
good idea  Or just attach a lynard,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  Like me,,,,,,,,,,,,,

When you're still toonin' in yer baffins, that's when ya know it's time to either wait a week or fish for lakers lol  Looks like fun.  Once the water warms up abit, I,ll have the neo,s on and flippers. BTW, those baffins float.LOL
We'll have to try & hook up for some toon'n at some point this year, nice report Brian
Forsure we will. Looking to fish lots of different places this summer. Mostly small back lakes I can get my toon to.
